caption: I have to say, I enjoyed my experience at Appioo. The taste is amazing and melts right in your mouth. The staff and service were delightful and professional. I was quite impressed with how the fast the service was. Give them a try, especially during this season where a lot of small businesses are struggling.

They Rude Af And Some Scammers. I Have Gave This Place A Couple Chances And They Still Fail Every time. DONT USE YOUR CARD HERE Somebody Will Have A House W/ 18 Bedrooms Somewhere In Another Country. ( Agusi Is Nasty Af ) Also Over Priced For Everything.

Red Snapper is very good. Red red is a must. I often get the fufu and goat meat with light soup. Highly recommend as best ghanian food in the whole DMV area. I travel 40 minutes for special occasion take out!
The goat burger was spectacular! Edit: Goat burger was still delicious when I tried it again four months later. Just make sure to call ahead as it takes about 35 minutes to make.
The food is absolutely great will be back. I had the red snapper cooked to perfection

This is the most authentic West African restaurant in DC. I feel at home anytime I go there. The receptionist Kofi and Vanessa are very great. They are friendly are very knowledgeable.  The food is awesome, I ate the Paper soup, came the following day and ordered red red and okra stew to go. Their homemade chicken with Apio is the best in the US.
I had a wonderful time and Vanessa was great!! She kept us laughing and my drink was on point.
I love coming here for the great peanut soup. Vanessa was amazing and very lively even though she was busy.
Delicious food and a comfortable, cozy atmosphere. Highly recommend the nkati nkwan (peanut butter soup) and a side of the fufu!

The receptionist on the phone was rude. Instead of being helpful she was eager to get me off the phone because I had a question. Once I received my food it was a strand of black hair in it. The owner had yet to reimburse me my money back. I courage you not to eat at this restaurant and find a better African cuisine somewhere else. The fufu was gross as well.

Ehhh. I’ve been here twice before in 2018 and 2019 and I feel as if the selection of food they provide was fresher back then. I usually get the same thing, the Jollof rice with goat. This time the goat was very over cooked, I couldn’t finish it to be honest. Not only that, but the sauce for the goat was very minimal so everything just seemed dry. However, I had the pleasure of trying the egusi soup which was good. This is my best friend’s favorite food place to eat so I most likely will not be returning unless I’m dragged here.
Amazing food. Great people. Great music. Live music.

My first time here. I had the red snapper with spicy rice and spinach and it was amazing!!!!! The establishment needs to have servers that are knowledgeable about the foods and drinks. I asked questions and expected answers about the foods and drinks. They also need a bartender to make the drinks!!!! A supply customers with better sturdy utensils for eating there meals!
Great food! Portion size was good as well. Make sure to make reservations due to covid.
Been here several times. Absolutely love the happy hour deals and yelp deals they offer. Super tasty food, everything we've had here has been good at the last and fantastic at the best.
Very rude and bad customer relationships.  The guy was so rude and disrespectful
If you would like to experience authentic Ghanaian food, please visit Appioo. The food and the customer service was amazing!! Each bite was flavorful and an experience!!
The food was excellent and will come back for more.
Good food, taste great can be small at night, hidden and small  place but cozy , if you like African food and hookah yes this can be a decent place.
Amazing Food and Atmosphere. Can't wait to revisit!!!

DONT GO HERE!!!!!!!  This place deserves zero stars if I could. Food took 30 MINUTES for pick up and the person at the door was so incredibly rude and put us IN DANGER by not following social distance guildlines and getting up in our FACE for questioning why the order was taking so long.  When we got there, the person who answered us at the Ring doorbell (because their store is closed for dine in due to COVID) told us 2 minutes. After the two minutes, they told us "a few more minutes" then again "another 5 minutes" and this isn't the first time they've tried to pull this for the order being delayed. We tried to patiently wait and the last time we rang the bell, no one answered so we knocked on the window instead and a man came out and GOT IN OUR FACES DURING COVID and said "don't knock and don't come here ever again" and we definitely WON'T. When he opened the door, it also wreaked of weed which I don't care about but if it hinders you from doing your job, then don't do it.  This isn't the first time this has happened with the long wait and this will certainly be the last because I will not risk my life to go here just to be spat at and disrespected by someone.  DONT GO HERE.
Omg the food was amazingly delicious!!! Social distance was in place, great music and atmosphere. I'll definitely be returning soon!
If you love Ghanaian food, do yourself a favor and check them out!  Great authentic food, good music and heavily poured drinks!  It's a whole vibe on Friday nights!

Soooo good and really hearty portions. Found via FeedtheMalik while trying to support black owned in DC and it was so good. Got the spinach stew with oxtail with Jollof rice and was enough for lunch and dinner if you can resist eating it all at once. Pepper soup with goat was unique and filling - very strong flavors and a great addition to the heavier rice dishes. Staff was really friendly and everything was still hot for pickup so made fresh.
Very disrespectful to their customers... my friends went there and they told me that their manager was very rude to them

Their jollof rice pretty good.  I’m Ghanaian btw, and it’s kind of nasty how they give you bare straws with their hand and there is nothing to cover the straw. That is very unsanitary and disgusting. And, the napkin they gave me for my utensils was dirty but it’s whatever.
Very tasty Ghanaian Dishes
Excellent food and service ! Best African restaurant in the DMV. Food is so flavorful! And it’s always a vibe there !  This place runs lapss around Bukom Cafe !

The entrees were very good, everything has mild heat to it so if you don't like spice at all you might ask for items with no spice. I enjoyed the jollof rice with goat and it was delicious. My companion enjoyed the palmnut soup with fufu. Large portions and very tasty. The friend plantains were delicious but a little spicy, they are served with salted peanuts which really brings out the flavor of them and tones down the heat... Everything is made when you order so expect to wait at 30 mins or more for your main course.. I wod definitely go back
Food is too overpriced for the size

This is the worst place I never recommend to anyone to visit. The customer service so terrible without professionalism so bad. We got to the place and find out a place to sit because not one was able to help us there. After awhile someone took our order and make us to wait for almost 40 minutes. When we asked to check out our food the unprofessional servers realize they didn’t place our order so upset for us being there waiting for so long and then asked to continue waiting. I will never come back or even recommend this place to not one.

I was at the restaurant and had to chase down waiter just to get a drink.  And then to get a table was another issue. The experience was awful.  Even when the waiter took my orders I waited over and hour and still did not see my food and finally when some one came by and I asked about the food then they said there must have been a mistake.and that our food had not been put in at all. I was so hungry I could  not wait any longer.
Great food, people, and atmosphere.

It was very easy to find. I think they need more hands to help out there. Ambience was on point, loved the lighting and the effort to play West African music. The food was good, but my hands was forced to buy extra large tilapia when I had budgetted for me large.
Great authentic African food bar and vibe, go check them out.
I was so disappointed,  I went and saw only one guest , we left after some time.i was very  surprised  because I received  the confirmation  message at 0510 pm.

I'm Haitian and was put on Ghanian food recently by a friend. Of course their's was homemade. I googled and went on a weekday in the late afternoon. Service was prompt and hospitable and it was not busy. I got the Egusi Soup with oxtail and pounded yam. You can choose another meet besides oxtail. The food was delicious!
My meal was amazing.  Very pricey, but that's because I got the whole snapper. Expect to pay $18 per entree to start. #DCisexpensive
Great food...nice ambiance...beautiful decor! Love it!
The food was lovely! One if the best African restaurants in the DMV area, you will not be disappointed!
This place! If you're like me and you're missing home cooked Ghanaian food
Very authentic Ghanian food. Live DJ at night time provides a great vibe. I tried the Egusi (ground melon seeds with spinach), and enjoyed it.
Good food, not over priced

Great place for a group to try new food. Plus they have tej (Ethiopian honey wine). Injera is very good and plentiful. Would recommend the samosa appetizer and the beef tibs, very tasty. Owner was very hospitable and friendly. Only a couple blocks from the metro station, would return next time I'm in the area.

Nice laid back atmosphere. The host/owner is very genuine and authentic. Proud Ghanaian as most are😊 The food was great as well. So many dishes that I had missed from Ghana was on the menu. Definitely returning again!!

If I could give ZERO stars I would. Waited 3hrs for my food because the waiter didn’t put in my order when I initially ordered. On top of not putting my order in he lied to me and claimed that someone else took my food and that I had to wait for them to remake it. I received no refund just cold food and a “sorry”. DO NOT. I REPEAT DO NOT. Order from this restaurant.

The management of this restaurant is too bad. It is worse than any other  places in DC. I don’t understand why the manager does not hire enough people. The first time I visited in April it was terrible, I had to wait more than 30 minutes to make my order, 45 minutes to get my meal and more than 20 minutes to pay. Today I went back and it is worse. Many people decided to leave after waiting too long!!! This is really a problem!

I used to look forward to coming here but recent complaints I’ve heard is serving sizes being down to half with no change in prices. A personal experience is having a tiny piece of meat (1/8 of usual amount) in a $22.00 meal. Hence you’re eating a $9.00 worth of food for $20.00. Long waits. But otherwise food tastes good.
I love everything
Good food and nice ambiance
Good food!
My first time having Ghanian food! Amazing! Friendly service, great music, local vibe, and authentic food- win/win
My credit card was duplicated in this establishment and have been trying to spend 1000s of dollars in online shops.
Food and seatings are mediocre, service was good. Portions are bit small and there’s barely any meat but just bones if you order oxtails or goat.
Food was absolutely amazing!! the spinach soup, this was the best African dish I ever had!!
The African food was so amazing when you're in DC this is the place to be
Consistency is what they have locked down!!

Got goat pepper stew along with jollof rice for my friend and I got pounded yam with their veggie stew. It was really good. I was surprised since I tend to be biased as a Nigerian (it's a Ghanian restaurant). Come for the authentic food, stay for the atmosphere!

If you want to be hustled come here. The vibes here are deceiving. Our waitress immediately started to up sell us on the large price for the medium fish, stating they only had large left. After we had ordered our apps and drinks, you would’ve thought she would’ve mentioned before we ordered anything that there was only one fish left for the evening (we sat for dinner at 4pm). The food was severely over priced for the quantity and quality of the dishes. We tried our best to support this black business as fellow Africans, by it was undeniable that our waitress had deliberately over charged us on several items we ordered. When we asked her about the discrepancies (being charged for goat when we ate beef, being charged double for a side that was clearly listed for $6) she aggressively doubled down by stating all items on the menu -including vegetables and rice  were subject to market price increase. None of this is written on the menu and quite frankly I was insulted at the blatant hustle taking place. She further insulted us by throwing several loose dollars at us from her tip jar which only further confused the situation.  We politely gave her back her tip jar money, paid and left.  Don’t hustle people you think are from outa town and don’t know any thing about west African food and what it actually costs to make it.  What a disappointment.  This is why our communities are not economically where they should be every one trying to get over on each other.
The food was delicious and the service was great!
Bomb.
Food doesn't taste well.
Excellent customer service and the best prepared food.
Great atmosphere, and music. Service was very prompt and the food was delicious! Definitely coming here again!
Wanting to meet africe don't miss visiting Appioo African Bar and Grill while in Washington DC

Caution: if you arent black he tries to up charge you.  One - the food isn't even fresh or authentic. Also, the guy jipped me on the bill... he added things that I didnt order, 25 dollars worth,  he raised the price on things that were priced differently on the menu.  I understand your somewhat new, but spend more effort on cleaning your kitchen, then trying to jip your unafrian patrons.

The food was extra oily and old. They served me meat that I could tell from the window to the kitchen was the same meat that had been sitting on the stove since the time I came in to wash my hands (before I even ordered).  I would not recommend this place. It made me sick the next day.
Fun atmosphere.  Good for a date or small group. The food is the real deal. Delicious choices abound.

I order red snapper with rice, and a separate order of fried goat meat to go . They literally gave me 4 pieces of bones, I should have checked the food before leaving. The red snapper was not season well, if I wanted to eat flavorless food I would have went to a Chinese restaurant and probably spend less. The only reason I’m giving 2 stars is because the waitress who handed me my food was lovely and nice.

Sat down, was given water and a menu. Then Waiting at the bar for a whole hour.... No service. Glad i didnt spend my money there. Went to Bokum. They have much better service. If i could give Zero stars i would.

I love seeing West African restaurants pop up in DC. I live close to this one but unfortunately prefer to drive further away for my West African food. Ghanaian restaurants are usually very good but Unfortunately this restaurant is over priced. Especially for the amount given. If 20 dollars is the flat rate for fufu at your place make it worth the customer’s while. Give enough meat and or enough soup. I will drive 20 minutes to get Good African food. Agama, Zion, 1230 9th St, Kofi’s bar, etc. These places give you a big portion that is worth the money and even then, their Fufu dishes are still under 15 Dollars. 14.99 tops you will see, but for this amount severed it’s not worth it.  Even The way my food was packed is even a whole another story that I don’t have time for on this.  Let’s just say my food seeped into the plastic bag.

Food was average. Full disclaimer, I am Nigerian and I don't think Ghanian food will ever be more than average to me. With that said, service was exceptional, probably the first African restaurant I have been to that didn't seem African. Servers were respectful, prompt and attentive. Will go back regardless
Excellent customer/food service and great ambiance. Food was also well-spiced. Only down side was that the fufu was a little too hard for my liking, other than that, food was 👍🏿
A true Ghanian experience. The food is amazing😍
Although they have very slow service the food is worth every bit of waiting time!
Best Jollof in America!!!

Tuesdays are a slow night, so you get lots of undivided attention from the staff. The waiter was great with recommendations for my meal. I had the fish, beans and plaintain dumplings. So good. I will definitely be back.
I had banku here and it reminded me exactly of West African food.
Food could use a little more flavor. Nice atmosphere though.
Casual environment. AMAZING food
The food was good!
Food was not as expected

The bartender/waitresses was sooo rude tonight, I’ve literally been going to appioo for years..Mr. Williams, the owner, and kofi have always been kind. But this non Ghanaian lady was so unkind...she literally busied herself with everything, besides customers, as if to punish us for eating there. I spent about $50 on bar bites and drinks...My Friend and I were unable to split a check according to this new waitress. I closed out our tab..not finishing my food I asked for a box and was charged $0.55....I literally had to run my card a second time to be charged fifty five cents for a box because I didn’t finish the food that I had already paid for..literally the worst service ever. I do not feel good having to beg to spend money, beg to buy drinks, beg to buy food, beg to pay my tab and close out, and then beg to receive a box and then be charged for it.
Good Western African food. Laid back environment. DJ on location with good music. Palm wine was available & was served with a Calabash cup. It validates the authentic feeling of home away from home.
Not so great with customer service. Some prices were typos which to me were their way to get you to spend more money. They need to fix their menu.
Ordered fufu and peanut butter soup to go. The food was excellent!
The food a service was great

Appioo is a great African Restaurant! My wife and I went there because the had Egussi on the menu and we weren't disappointed. The Goat Sujah was very spicy (like I like it) and tasty. Plantains were served hot and very good and the Foo Foo and Egussi were just like we like it. The drinks were very good also. The night that we went they had a DJ playing great music too.

OMG! I have been to A LOT of Restaurants but hands down this is one of the Best Ghanaian African food I have ever had and I recommend for everyone who is looking for authentic Ghanaian food. Oh plus bonus great service. Truly you get what you pay for. Thank me later!
Ate the food and we all ended up with bad running tummy. Tasted nice otherwise
My first time having Ghanian food! Amazing! Friendly service, great music, local vibe, and authentic food- win/win

This place is slightly hidden but it is a gem. They serve very lovely Ghanian dishes. I ordered Jollof rice and goat meat,  I would never order goat meat because of bad experiences in the past,  the waiter recommended it so I gave it a try, I would definitely order it again that's how good it was. I am giving them 4 stars because of the juice,  I ordered a mango juice and it did not taste like it, it tasted more like peach, it just wasn't nice.
The food was excellent; seasoned well, fresh, and delicious! That was some good eaten. I even got to hug the Chef!!!

The wait time my family experienced was horrendous. It should not take 1 hour+ to get our food when it’s not busy. We drove for quite awhile just to come to this place. If you really want to eat here, ORDER AHEAD OF TIME. The service was literal trash. It took 45 mins to get my appetizer. MY APPETIZER! Don’t waste your time on this establishment. There are better African restaurants elsewhere.
this was horrible it took more than 1 hour to get my dish out and I love 2 hours away they need faster services and more people in their business not only one.im very disappointed
Great spot. Good music and vibes.
Great food healthy portions
Great Ghanaian atmosphere and really tasty and authentic food. Every option is a delicacy!

This place is great! I’ve walked by it many times but never gone in. Had a friend from Togo visiting and we went there right at 2pm when they opened on Saturday. GREAT food! Atmosphere is nice. There was a surprising amount of people there right around that time, which was nice. I would like to come back late night to see if there is kinda of a lounge feel, which I anticipate there is. I will be back
Great African food and cosy

I’ve been coming here for years. Moved away came back still come here a couple times a month. I noticed the large togo container went from being filled to the top to less than that with each visit. One time the owner told the guy to put more soup in the bowl because it was basically empty. Today the food came in a container half the old containers size. But my cost was the same. The food is sooooo good but charging me the same (already a little steep but I consider it a specialty) for half the food won’t fly. There’s too many options for west African food in dc to battle u st parking for half the food/whole price. Sucks but I’m done with this. Not again. U lost a regular regular.
Great food, great environment
They got a new DJ(D J 911) rolling afropop hit jams every weekend. I love his selection of songs. Nice place to be on a weekend
Wonderful place, good food.
Food was good, and it came on time.
This place was 👍🏿👍🏿👍🏿👍🏿👍🏿. Atmosphere was also very nice

My family and I went for dinner last night - food was great, service was good. The only slight issue we had was that at the top of the menu it states “all entrees come with a side of your choice” so we ordered and ordered the sides we wanted. When it came time to pay, we saw additional charges for the sides. It was pretty confusing, and I think the correct way to handle it would have been to remove the charges this time and we would know for the future. They didn’t offer that, so we just paid and went on our way. I still would definitely go back, I just would be prepared to pay additional if I want a side. Prices seem high now that I know they don’t come with a side. I ordered the jollof rice entree with goat, and it was lovely. The side of spinach was VERY garlic-y and I wouldn’t order it again.
Good atmosphere, good food, good management!!
Relaxed atmosphere and decent food.
Loved the food.
Great place to enjoy yourself. A hidden gem

Best west African food in DC. Arrive with some time on your hands. I enjoy the place best when the reggae music is on and the television volume is down all the way.  Food is delicious. Good folks. Great place.

Appioo African Bar and Grill has been my home for African food for about a year now. I drive 40 minutes from out of the city to satisfy my cravings for home cooked food and everytime it is worth it. My favorite dish is Waache (beans and rice) with your choice of protein. I can’t explain the poor reviews other than our fellow Africans are extremely critical of each other when things are bad but rarely compliment when things are good...The reason my rating is a solid 5 stars! I’m critical to a fault... This time though, I have to give credit where credit is due after a year of great service. Thank you, Mr. Prince and my favorite bartender Danielle!

Visited with some friends for the Bob Marley performance. We bought tickets before hand but found it was not necessary. No one was checking tickets...so we wasted money on that. Food is flavorful (get the jollof rice and chicken). Platter was disappointing ( smal portions) for my hubby and friends but no complaints on taste. I highly recommend taking a uber!

If i could leave no stars, I would. The customer service at this place is horrible. I came into town to go to this restaurant for it’s authentic African food. My friends and I ordered our food and after waiting an hour after ordering, we asked the waitress the estimated time we can expect our meal. Her response was “the food will come out when it comes out”. Absolutely not. I do not pay money at a restaurant to be treated with such disrespect. The waitress never came to our table to check on us or to ask if we needed anything after waiting over an hour. My friends and I left the restaurant with no food after waiting an hour and a half. If this restaurant wants to stay in business, they need to hire people who can communicate efficiently and speak to customers with some sense. I will not be returning to this restaurant ever again. I will take my business else where

The food, the decorations and overall atmosphere was good. The thing they fail miserably at, is the customer service. They have an extremely poor customer service! I Hope I Never get to come here ever again!!!!
Consistent food preparation and flexible with parties and dance nights.  Rum punch is true to the original. Drinks are reasonably priced.
Great place for Ghanaian jollof

Come for the Pepper Soup! Everything we tried was delicious. My friend who has spent a lot of time in West Africa was raving about the authenticity of the food. I was looking to cope with being homesick for Bahamian food. This is legit
Great Ghanaian food

Customer service was deplorable. Totally unsatisfied. They sold me  a small Red Snapper and charged the price for the size of a large one. I will never go there again. Although the food is tastey, but i would rather have excellent customer service and if the food is not tastey I'm happy with the service which will aid in the food tasting good. Sorry Appioo you just lost a VERY GOOD CUSTOMER. You cheated me!!!
Ideal choice for those looking for a good African restaurant with varieties of meat, fish, vegetables as well as beer choices. Located on 9th st NW dc.
Foods is amazing.  It took a while but it was worth it.
Tasty, authentic southern Ghanaian food!!
Wasn't there

Don't sit on this place! Seriously.... Tucked underneath the street level is one of the best food spots I have happened upon. I had never had traditional African food before and this food was exquisite!!!! And the waitress was super patient with all the excessive questioning about ingredients (I know, I know... Hate being that person but I was curious about everything!) We ordered multiple things and let me honestly tell you... EVERYTHING WAS DELICIOUS!!! WOULD TOTALLY GO BACK!!!
Great food
Great food

Usually very good quality food and service, not today though!!  Disappointed at: - My take home boiled yam is black and white.. Mad I didn't look before leaving restaurant. No good.  - Bartender showed no genuine customer service. was barley given a shot of appioo drink after waiting and watching getting served before other customers that came in restaurant after me. I asked did the amount given of appioo change and was told no. Very weird that when a man came in after me and ordered appioo drink the bartender gave them exactly what is usually poured to all customers.  Bad experience. I hope things can get better and everyone gets served equally.!!
Great atmosphere, great food
Home away from home. If you are in DC and yearn for authentic Ghanaian meals, look no further. Appioo African Bar and Grill got you covered.
Great please, awesome customer service, very tasty food...thank you Jasmine 👍
Thanks to brother Mike, who took me to this awesome African restaurant. The cuisine was magnificent and the service was fantastic. Try Appioo!
Great food and warm service...
Ordered fufu and peanut butter soup to go. The food was excellent!  The blend of spices, peanut butter, pepper, ginger and etc.were perfect. I will be back again.
Food was sooooo good with good service!!!
Great food but the portions are a little small for the prices. Also the wait is too long.

Worst service ever. We were charged and ordered Large, but they gave us Small and when we wanted to get our correct order, they didn't want to give it to us. The prices are ridiculous and not fair at all! Wouldn't recommend this place, hands down not going back, not even if they pay me to go.
My 3rd time and just as good as the 1st! Rum punch and Jollof rice are the delicious!
Worst service I’ve ever had .i trusted Grubhub for the rating it does not make sense
AFRICAN FOODS

I was served raw chicken suya, and I ordered the 20 dollar platter with plantain as one of my choices(you can pick four items in a 20 dollar platter). I only got two plantain slices. -_- I asked for more but was denied. Be careful if you decide to come here.
Great food
We had a blast!
Great food
Great, fresh salad. I ordered the peanut soup with rice balls and goat as the protein. The spices, my word. Love this hidden jewel downstairs and will certainly go back
Great food, music and staff.
Great food, great hosts, clean environment and most of all music!
Nice atmosphere . music great and the staff especially bartenders are friendly
The food was too Spicy. 🤢
It was just OK for me, nothing exciting, I was celebrating my cousin bday, maybe I'll go back I heard they have a band sometimes.
Great and authentic Ghanaian cuisine and drinks

Looked more Caribbean on the outside but was African on the inside. Their suya was overly spicy and i believe it will be helpful if they put the pepper with suya powder in a small bowl on the side. I loved their choice of music too. Overall, not too bad for an African restaurant in DC.
Splendid African meals
Food is tasty, environment lively, staff is friendly and very informative of culture and dishes. However food is kinda pricey.

Food was nothing to write home to mom about. Staff are rude and forgetful. Prices are way too high. Location is hard to find. Glasses have water spots. Menus were sticky. Add ons are the only way to get to a meal that makes sense.
Worst service ever. The entire restaurant was livid. Took over an hour to get a glasses of sprite (when we ordered water) Also way overpriced. Nice wall art though.
Good African food 🤗 nd the good vibing music nd of course the bar tender 👍😍

This is easily my favorite bar on U street, especially after so many have become so trendy and generic. The food here is authentic, the drinks aren't just the same ole drinks; everything is special and the atmosphere is so relaxing. Try an Appioo only of you are ready for that drama (man drink warning), otherwise the rum punch is the best I've had since Trinidad.
My food was WONDERFUL!!!!! AM DEFINITELy COMING BACK VERY SOON. VERY OFTEN. LOVED THE VIBE IN YHIS PLACE. DEFINITELY A CHILL SPOT. FOOD & ENERGY WAS AMAZING. Peop!e sleep on this place.
Tasty food!
Food was ok. Service was terrible👎
The food at Appioo is for those with a  discerning palate who appreciates authenticity.

Didn't feel like driving to MD to my usual GH spot, so stopped by appioo.One of the last standing authentic GH food joints in the area and is fairly good, but my goodness the portions at appioo has steady (& significantly)  decreased since I first started going. I looked at my $18 plate and couldn't help but laugh. and this goat? dompe nkwaa
Really good food and awesome DJ after hours
Nice West African dishes

Woww. I love the meals here. So far, the only place in DC that makes me enjoy food like back home🇬🇭. I’m 99% confident you wouldn’t regret their dish if you make the right choice that suits your taste especially if it’s your first time eating there. Appio restaurant has my food heart❤️❤️It’s a 5-star for me

I was looking for a good west african restaurant in DC and found Appioo. The food itself was good but we literally had to wait over an hour to get our orders and the place was not even full. Has the potential to be great.
Very spicy.
Best West African fare in D.C. fresh ingredients and attentive cooking.
Nice Dive  Good Food and Roots
Good West Africa food (from Ghana)

In my experience  If you can go to a restaurant during the week and their food is fresh and delicious then that's a restaurant worth going back to...... I had the most delicious "Red Snapper fish with Jollof rice" and salad.....  very authentic Ghanaian/African food.  The food is prepared in a vegan style, meaning without the meat, the meat is added at the time of your order when requested !!! One more thing great hospitality and music

Outstanding place. The minute I walked in, the owner (and, presumably, the head chef), greeted me with a smile. He told me of a special occasion that was going on that Saturday; that the place would be open to the public at 2PM, but that he was going to have me sit down and let me order nevertheless - which he kindly did. He came with the menu and explained some of the dishes to me. He was very friendly and personable. Across the bar, where I was sitting, was his wife. After I placed my order with one of his children there helping them, his wife came around and nicely chatted with me in a warm yet friendly manner as did her husband. She made sure my order was correctly placed after she explained the difference between some of their good beers.  Now, I ordered "Wings" to start, which come with the "Appioo Sauce" on the side. Boy, is that sauce good! Well, you go there and try it yourself - fantastic flavor. My main course was the "Spinach Stew," but I asked to modify it and have it with "Fufu" instead of rice: they accommodated this with ease. I feasted for about 20 minutes. Their "Fufu" melted in my mouth. I remember feeling full but could not stop eating. That's how good the food (and my experience at the Appioo) was.  I commend the place (the owners, the service and the food) to you very highly!  Nicolas J. Nesta.
Everyone at the table was so excited to share everything and we could not stop exclaiming about how delicious the food was. Generous portions and flavors off the beaten path.
Loved it

I ate hollow rice and goat meat. The food was ok but they don’t take care of there customer. I ask for water and so many time and never give to me until I left that’s so shame. But somebody should talk to the owner so they can hire more people for the service.

So for graduation  I decided to celebrate with family and friends at this quaint ASo for graduation  I decided to celebrate with family and friends at this quaint AFRICAN restaurant in Washington DC. I knew the service was not optimal but the food  and  ambiance were great; not stuffy and great African music. In addition, I decided if I’m spending money I might as well support a local African business.  Man!!!! Let me first start with the good; the food, music and ambiance were great. The service was a complete disaster. First, when we got there the tables were not ready despite the fact that I gave them an hour heads up. The waiter failed to order drinks for my guest. I had to “encourage” them to make haste on the order. In addition to the initial drinks debacle, the waiter got the drinks orders wrong for many of my guest. Second debacle, I ordered appetizers for my guest which were great but there was no one to clear the food from the table so my guest and I were sitting with plates of bones and things.  Back to the drinks. After 2 hours of conversation, laughter and a somewhat good time, the waiter proceeds to go around the table to ask my guest about their drink order; “Excuse me, I can’t remember your drink order? what is your name and what did you order to drink?”  Back to the food. The menu was never presented to my guest. I had to retrieve it, myself. Half of my guest ordered food from the menu which never came. In addition the ones that came were incomplete. For example, one of my guest ordered snapper which comes grilled or fried with jollof. My guest was served one dry fried fish with nothing else.  To top in off, when I question the owner about my bill and indicated this was not what we agreed to, he had the audacity to tell me he was doing me a favor. Now, on average this place does only 8 people at one time and I had about 24 guests. How I did him a favor is beyond me. Long story short I show him the communication where we agreed on a certain price and he shamefully complied.  The owner really did himself a disservice because he lost so much money by not having an adequate and efficient staff. It’s really unfortunate because the spot is really nice.
Definitely, and highly, recommended you visit this place. Food is excellent and the service is beyond amazing
Delicious food!!
Love this place , the flood is authentic and bring you the real taste of Ghana.  Must try the pepper soup with goat.

Yyyyyoooo!!!! This food is FIYAH! I've been several times now and I love it! The food is amazing, the service is fast and they even brought my food to the car because I couldn't find a parking space. I drive all the way from the Southside for this eats!...  Thank you for your amazing service and commitment to the African/ Ghanaian/ African American community!
best Ghanaian food in DC coming from a Nigerian
Good african food
Great
Food is really good! Try the Jallof!
Cool African music
Had a great cocktail after my fufu. Food takes a bit long to be served but ok.
Wish i could give more stars but maybe i'll try them again.
It was okay. The drinks were weak. Wasn't worth the $20 to get in. The dj was good.
great food
Home away from home
Food was amazing an authentic . Definitely would come back.

I was extremely disappointed in this establishment...not even sure where to start.  My fiance is Ghanaian and had been craving kenkey and bitters since he arrived in the US so I thought we'd try this place. We got there a little after 6pm and sat at the bar. I ordered the kelewele to start....which came out slightly burnt and the plaintains werent very sweet but they somewhat tasted like the real thing so we obliged. I then asked about the happy hour menu. The bartender told us that all the drinks were $5. So my fiance ordered the bitters (2) and I ordered the rum punch and the black margarita. I watched the owner make the black margarita with Jack Daniels instead of Makers Mark as described on the menu and quickly asked him about it. He gave us some BS answer about Jack tasting better than Makers but any real drinker knows that's not true...we also know the price difference between the two so seemed like he was just being cheap... not wanting to argue we obliged once again. When the food came out...we were disapointed once again. The kenkey came out with 3 little pieces of fish instead of a whole fish and only one kenkey ball for $18. complete rip off. I ordered the spinach and fish, which was pretty good, but the jollof rice had to have been the plainest jollof rice Ive ever tasted... they probably shouldnt even call it that. The worst part was when the bill came and the owner didnt want to honor the happy hour prices that his waitress told us about. He pushed his waitress on us to discuss the matter while he sat across the bar and watched. He then has his waitress show us some happy hour list that we had never seen and the waitress said she had never seen.  At the end he only honored the happy hour for 2 of the 4 drinks despite HIS employees mistake. I would love to support black/african businesses but until they start to understand that a good reputation is better than money they will never see their full potential.... I will never step foot in or support this business again. Very disappointed.
(Translated by Google) fun  (Original) Kul
Nice and cozy joint. Well prepared African meal... but needs some touches.
Great location, ambience. music, service, food, drinks, and prices. Authentic Ghanian cuisine.
Average service
Good African food

Yummy food. Great music. The staff are very nice and personable.
Good food. Changed prices and did not let anyone know so our bills were more then we expected.
Great place in DC for African food
I love this place good food good music. I call it the house of Afro Beats music.
Great bar
Friendly associates plus sumptuous, tasty, delicious meal in a serene environment
Too expensive

This place has a great vibe and the food is even better! My meal was delicious and the server was very friendly. I will definitely have to stop by again whenever I come back to DC. Also love how they have vegetarian options.
Great Ethiopian food and nice owner!
Best african food on U street.
Pretty good food. Service good. A little loud. Not a huge amount of seating.
Great place to eat, friendly environment
Great food, great service and exceptionally clean and very professional services.
Best cuisine and spirits in DC. Very reasonably priced as well.
Delicious West African food.  Well worth the wait.  Expect to wait.
Great eat in basement style fashion don't expect much else. Sometimes there's a long wait but enjoy.
Delicious food!
Worst experience.... waited for 1:45mins for our food. My daughter was so hungry and just wanted some fries... I'm definitely never and never goin back.
Great fufu and peanut soup! The owner/ staff was great and extremely accommodating considering they were also short staffed. I recommend this if you want some authentic Ghanaian food.
Nice clean environment, with amazing food that tasted great! Best Ghanaian food in the area!! Visiting is a must!!
Great Food and Great Service
Great customer service
Great customer service

The place is ok. You don't get the value for your money. A bit  disappointed. I ordered  jollif and goat meat. When  I received it, it  was chips of goat. When I inquired with the  waitresses she was uncomfortable to respond. Did she really tell the manager? No.

We came in and ordered appetizers, have been waiting for 30 minutes. A larger group just came in and got their food already. Meanwhile, we are still waiting,  going on 45 minutes. Worst customer service. Will not be returning.  ETA: We ended up leaving because no food or no explanation of the delay after over an hour of waiting. Regardless of the group that ordered ahead, it still doesn't take over an hour for appetizers. Warning: you risk poor customer service going to this place.

Did a search for "African food near me" while at work and this was one of the restaurants that came up.  Put it in the GPS and went there.  Ordered the Spinach Stew with chicken and fufu to go.  Sat down to just taste it before I left to go back to work. Needless to say, not only did I "taste" it, I continued eating until it was almost gone.  It was delicious!  Loved the way the owner made it a "family affair" with the daughter wiping the tables and the son taking my order.  They even brought me ice water without me even asking once they saw I stayed instead of taking out.  Food was great, service was great.  Can't wait to go back!
Good Ghanaian food
There is no better west African restaurant in dc

Everything about this restaurant is wrong. The whole atmosphere screamed disorganization. The service was the worst I've ever received in my entire life. We waited over an hour for our food just to receive it cold with dry meat. The waitress had a nasty attitude the entire night. The plantains were unevenly cooked and a soggy mess and the jollof was definitely not Ghanaian jollof. The prices they charged for such poor quality food is outrageous. Overall I'd rate it 0/5 but that's not an option so 1/5 will do. Just don't go there. It's a waste of money for poor service and nasty food.
Nice Mix crowd. Good food.
Delicious food! It takes a while to get the food, but the music is nice in the meantime and the drinks are good. I almost always get the egusi and it does not disappoint!
Very good jollof.
This place is by far one of my top 3 Afrkan restaurants in the US.

I visited D.C. for the weekend and wanted African food. I saw an article recommending this place so I decided to give it a try. It's small and unassuming but most African restaurants are. The decor is actually quite nice and there is a large screen TV playing music videos. It took my friend and I an hour to get our food. This may be because half of the tables in the place were all seated at the same time. The waitress was nice and service was good but the kitchen was slow. I enjoyed the wine I ordered. The palmnut soup wasn't as flavorful as what I'm used to. I asked for some shitto (pepper sauce) to spice it up but the shitto wasn't at all spicy. I wasn't very impressed but I would try this place again.
I have been going to Appioo for the last three they have the Best African Food

Food was good but it seems like once Prince leaves u get different food. Honestly I got one order and the food was great meat was tender, I thought it was so good that I ordered another of the same thing. Prince had to leave for some reason. Whoever is plating or cooking the food when Prince is not there sucks, my second order had tough meat and instead of extra spinach he gave me bullshit ass salad. Bartender was cool but won't be going back. Summahs is better, at least the cooks there understand what extra Means and don't bullshit you. The food was night and day between the boss and the terrible cook in his place. My advice is, if Prince/ the boss is there u will get good food if he isn't and the other cook is there then ur getting garbage and don't bother
Out of town. Wanted some home cooked meal.  Took my money but didn't give me what I order.when I called, they said they couldn't do anything about it.
Yours truly will be there
We get so lit here. Check out @capitalcannanews on Instagram or search #wickedthursdayz to see just how lit we get here.
Approved ! As a jollof rice junkie , this is one of the tastiest.Properly cooked croaker with flavorful tomato sauce.
the food is great and service was lovely!! great find. Be sure to try the cassava leaf with Goat.
This restaurant was amazing! The food was authentic and seasoned perfectly. The staff was helpful and welcoming. Also the atmosphere was warm and inviting. I highly recommend it!
Great Food and Great people.. Love the place, A bit pricey but what can you expect.

Delicious and reasonably priced Ghanian food...don't be fooled by the humble space. The goat and oxtail were both delicious. As was the pepper soup! My friend, who lived im Ghana for a year said it was the most authentic Ghanian food she had had since coming back to the US!
The food is delicious! Prices are reasonable I feel. Owner is friendly and warm, great bartenders.

This place! If you're like me and you're missing home cooked Ghanaian food this is the place for you. I'm still waiting to trot over there and try their banku but so far my experience there has been excellent. Really good authentic food. Oh, they're on uberEats also. Get ready to spend all your money.
Great food and service, but way too pricey.
Love the food. My taste of home away from home, GH.
Just great food.  Don't be thrown by the hole-in-the-wall location.
The food here is really good and it has a real family atmosphere...West African fare and a great music. However the place is a bit overpriced compared to other areas

The food and atmosphere was exactly what I was looking for. I am from the US but live in Ghana and love the food and culture that I find there. Appioo was a great touch of Ghana home with warm and friendly staff, and spot on Ghanaian dishes. I would recommend this to anyone, whether you are looking to expand your taste palate, or looking for a reminiscent meal from your home country or time abroad, you will enjoy Appioo.
Quality reminds me of Peace Corps. Legit.

My new favorite DC spot...everything was dope: the food, service and the environment. I had the vegetable fish and my friend had the egusi soup with goat meat--we cleaned our plates! The server was super cool, too. This is one of those businesses you don't want to see go away so i intend to support whenever i can. Support Black-owned businesses!
Really good African food but slow service

I have gone to this restaurant since it opened the food is delicious and the staff is very friendly.  Food is made to order so please go in with appropriate expectations of how long you will wait. Everything is fresh, taste delicious, and I have even brought some of my African friends to the spot and they say it's authentic and well-made. If you're going for drinks The bartenders are always on point and are willing to mix up something special for you that was surely help you reach your goals.
Great nice little place. My only negative is that some of the prices advertised on the menu did not match the bill we received.
Amazing place and food! The place itself has great personality and hidden in plain sight! The people serving are delightful too, it brings an authentic Ghanaian hospitality feel to your meal.

I just finished a great meal of Jollof Rice with Chicken - my first taste of Ghanaian cuisine. At the same time the complex mix of flavors in the dish come together perfectly leading me to wonder why more people haven't discovered Appioo's restaurant yet. The staff are friendly and I'm def. going to keep on coming back.
